title: [ENH] forecasting: exogeneous to multivariate reducer
body:
I think we should have the following forecaster that takes two forecasters A and B (could be the same) and creates a multivariate forecaster. Parameters are a subset of variables given to B, "variable subset B". This determines "variable subset A" which is all variables in `y` minus "variable subset B".

In `fit`:
* forecaster B is fit to forecast "variable subset B" of `y`, using `X` as exogeneous.
* forecaster A is fit to forecast "variable subset A" of `y`, using `X` plus "variable subset B" as exogeneous.

In `predict`:
1. forecaster B is used to forecast "variable subset B" to `fh`, using `X` as exogeneous
2. forecaster A is used to forecast "variable subset A" of `y` to `fh`, using `X` plus the forecasts from step 1 as exogeneous.

An interesting special case is where:
* B is a `ColumnForecaster`, using a single univariate forecaster C
* A is a univariate forecaster C
* "variable subset A" is a single variable

Putting this above into a `ColumnForecaster` another time allows to reduce multivariate forecasting to univariate forecasting with meaningful cross-forecasts.

That special case involving two `ColumnForecaster`s should have its own shorthand.

pinging @aiwalter, @mloning, and @GuzalBulatova who wrote the `ColumnForecaster`.
